Lady Erliza of Snowdown
A gorgeous and accomplished human woman artificer turned vampire lord. She is supported by her arcane creations, vampiric powers, and extensive magical knowledge. Her strategic blend of mechanical mastery and vampiric might makes her a unique and powerful vampire. A combination of Arcane complexity, vampiric power, and dark elegance.
Lady Erliza, The Bloodsmith of Snowdown (Formerly Known as Elspeth Varadin of Amn)
Name: Lady Erliza (formerly Elspeth Varadin)
Race: True Vampire (Blueblood lineage, Human)
Age: Immortal, looks about 24
Classes: Artificer (Battle Smith) 16 / Vampire 9
Alignment: Lawful Evil
Hit Dice: 25 (16d8 Artificer + 9d10 Vampire + 100)
Hit Points: 255
Ability Scores: Strength: 18 (+4), Dexterity: 18 (+4), Constitution: 18 (+4), Intelligence: 20 (+5), Wisdom: 14 (+2), Charisma: 20 (+5)
Speed: 40 ft. Proficiency Bonus: +7
Background: Sage
Saving Throws: Constitution (+11), Intelligence (+12), Wisdom (+9), Charisma (+12)
Skills: Arcana (+12), History (+12), Insight (+9), Perception (+9), Persuasion (+12; expertise from Blueblood lineage), Deception (+12; advantage from Physique)
Resistances: necrotic 
Immunities: Charm, Compulsions, Phantasms, Patterns, Morale effects, poison, sleep, stun. Ability drain, energy drain, nonlethal damage, penalties to your physical ability scores (Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution), not at risk of death from massive damage.
Combat Stats
Armor Class: 21 (Breastplate of Balance [AC 14 + 2 Dex] + 2 Physique + 2 Bracers + 1 Ring of Protection)
Vampiric Traits
Regeneration: 10 HP per turn unless damaged by radiant energy or running water.
Undead Resilience: No need to breathe, eat, or sleep; functions indefinitely with 8 pints of blood per 9 days.
Forbiddance: Cannot enter a residence uninvited.
Sunlight Weakness: Takes 10 radiant damage per turn in sunlight.
Spider Climb: Can climb on surfaces effortlessly.
Unnatural Sight: Darkvision 120 ft.
Physique: +2 Natural AC; advantage on Deception and Persuasion checks.
Stake the Heart: Paralyzed if staked through the heart.
Harmed by Holy Water: Takes 10 acid damage from holy water.
Blueblood Lineage Traits. Persuasion skill expertise.
Vampiric Powers (Level 1, 2, 4, 6, 8)
Charm: Disadvantage on saves against her Charm. Charmed people are charmed for 14 (5+9) days and subject to Command. Charmed creatures remain so for 9 days (equal to Vampire Hit Dice) and subject to Command. You can charm any creature with your charm power, not just humanoids as per the Charm Monster spell. For creatures (not people), you may charm creatures with a maximum CR equal to your vampire Hit Dice. You may charm a number of creatures equal to your vampire Hit Dice. Charm attempts (creatures) after reaching your maximum just fail. And these creatures remain charmed for a number of days equal to your vampire Hit Dice. Your spell save DC is 8 + your charisma modifier + proficiency.
Legendary Actions: (3 per round; options: Attack, Magic, Bonus action, Move)
Legendary Resistance: (3/day) Can succeed on a failed saving throw.
Children of the Night: Summon swarms of bats/rats or wolves (double quantities and duration due to Vampire level 9).
Shapechanger: Can shift into mist form or back as a bonus action.
Vampiric Weaknesses
Fear of Divine Wrath: Disadvantage against Turn Undead; psychic damage on failure.
Racial Blood Type: Humans
Gender Blood Taste: Men
Insatiable Thirst: Must feed every night.
Bloodlust
Multiattack: Three claw attacks or two claws and one bite per Attack action. 
Bite: +11 to hit, 1d4+4 damage plus Drain.
Vampire Claw: +11 to hit, 1d6+4 slashing.
Extra Attack
Spellcasting (Level:Slots = 1:4, 2:3, 3:3, 4:2), Spell Save DC: 23, Spell Attack Modifier: +15
Cantrips (4): Sword burst, Prestidigitation, Guidance, Mage Hand, Mending, Fire Bolt, lightning lure.
Prepared Spells Include (13): 1st: Witch Bolt (1 free), heroism, shield, Alarm, Catapult, Expeditious retreat. 2nd:branding smite, warding bond, Alter Self, Invisibility, See Invisibility, Vortex Warp. 3rd: aura of vitality, conjure barrage, Haste, Dispel Magic, Tiny Servant. 4th: aura of purity, fire shield, Stoneskin, Resilient Sphere, Mordenkainen's Faithful Hound.
Artificer (Battle Smith) Features
Steel Defender: Hybrid undead-construct fueled by blood magic.
Arcane Jolt (5 times): Deals additional 4d6 damage or heals 4d6 HP.
Flash of Genius: +5 bonus to ability checks or saving throws 5/day.
Spell Storing Item: Simple or Martial Weapon stores 1st or 2nd level spell and can be cast 10 times (Int Modifer x 2). She has a dagger that she casts spells on: invisibility, see invisibility, blur, and Enlarge/Reduce, Catapult, and Sanctuary. Pick one for that day.
Origin Feat (human): Magic Initiate (Wizard). 
ASI (Level 4): Telekinetic (+1 Int to 19, mage hand is invisible +30 ft range, telekinetic shove DC 20)
ASI (Level 8): Spell Sniper (+1 Cha to 19, increase spell range by 60 ft.)
ASI (Level 12): Ritual Caster (+1 Int to 20, Wizard spells.)
ASI (Level 16): War Caster (+1 Cha to 20, Adv on Con savs for Concentration, Reactive spell.)
The artificer class ability to attune extra items (RAW) is nerfed by my house rule to allow attuned items equal to your PB +1. Therefore, this class ability allows her to attune her infusions at the number indicated. These attunements of infusions are in addition to the normal attunement limits (house rule).
Infusions (Limits: 10 known, 5 items, 5 attunements):
Boots of speed (attuned): Double speed
Bracers of Defense (attuned): +2 AC
Ring of free action (attuned): Not held or slowed
Ring of protection (attuned): +1 AC and Saves
Gem of True Seeing (attuned): True seeing 120’ for 10 minutes, 3/day.
Homunculus bat (used a ruby for the heart, attunement not required, may use Repeating bow instead since she has familiar and steel defender).
Magic Items (Limits: 8 attunements):
Breastplate of Balance (Attuned): Breastplate AC 14+ 2 Dex. This burnished copper breastplate looks as if it were made of interlocking gears. Merchant's scales are emblazoned across the chest. The armor has 4 charges. You can use the charges in the following ways while wearing the armor: 
	Equalize. When you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself is about to roll a d20 with advantage or disadvantage, you can expend 1 charge and take a reaction to prevent the roll from being affected by advantage or disadvantage.
	Expunge Imbalance. As a bonus action, you can expend 2 charges to cast the Lesser Restoration spell from the armor.
The armor regains 1d4 expended charges daily at dawn.
Force Beads (6)
Ring of Radiant Resistance
Scrolls: Teleport (2), Wall of Force, Forcecage (2), Eyebite, Greater Invisibility (3), Disintegrate, Arcane Gate, Symbol, Plane Shift, Mass Suggestion.
Alchemy Jug
Decanter of Endless Water
Eversmoking Bottle
Immovable Rod
Sending Stones (Paired key charmed people)
Dust of Disappearance (3 uses)
Oil of Slipperiness
Sovereign Glue
Universal Solvent
Folding Boat

Bloodforged Equipment:
Bloodforged Sunlight Shield (Blood infused, attuned): This is a custom, one-of-a-kind item of her own manufacture. It appears as an intricately woven silver chain tiara with a single star shaped onyx gem at the center. Use reaction to spend one of its 5 blood infusions to create a shadowy bubble around her (like resilient sphere spell) that allows her to see out, but blocks line of sight to her, blocks sunlight, and blocks radiant damage for one minute.
Bloodforged All-purpose Tool (+3 Arcane Focus, attuned)
Bloodforged Ring of Spell Storing (attuned): Shield (x3), Silvery Barbs.
Bloodforged Ring of Spell Storing (attuned): Wall of Force
Bloodforge Shield Guardian Amulet (attuned): Comes with a bloodforged Shield Guardian
Bloodforged Invisibility Cloak (attuned)
Bloodforge Guardian Brooch (attuned)
Constant Companions:
Charmed human male personal servants (x 4) that are sages/scribes, magic initiates (wizard). (She feeds on them occasionally, but she prefers fresh human males and she needs to feed daily.)
Pseudodragon familiar.
Steel Defender.
Bloodforged Shield Guardian.
Standard Practice Protections:
She has cast Mordenkainen’s Private Sanctum under her castle to protect her resting place which contains her personal laboratory, library, servant rooms, and feeding rooms. She cast Alarm on her resting place (coffin underneath the castle in a secret chamber within the sanctum). 
The only door into the resting place has an arcane lock, mechanical lock, mechanical trap, and glyph of warding (Thunder). On her coffin, the lid has the spell Symbol cast on it, DC 23 to notice it. Trigger is the lid opening by anyone other than herself, the effect is “Death” doing 10d10 necrotic DC 23 Con save for half, in 60ft radius, to each target, each turn.
She casts Mordenkainen's Faithful Hound, and Tiny Servant with any unused 3rd and 4th level spell slots (potentially 6 servants) before resting each day and keeps them in the resting place while she rests. 


Before Vampirism – The Lost Artificer of Amn
Birth Name: Elspeth Varadin
Background: Amnian noblewoman, daughter of a powerful merchant house that specialized in enchanted wares and warforged exports.
Expertise: A master of blood-bound artifice, developing life-infused constructs and arcane engines that blurred the line between life and machinery.
Downfall:
Her research was too valuable to simply outlaw or destroy. Instead, it sparked a vicious power struggle among Amnian merchant lords who sought to control or steal her discoveries.
Betrayed by a former patron, she was forced to flee, vanishing into the lawless fringes of the Moonshaes.
She ended up in Snowdown, where she thought she could rebuild her work in secret.

Lady Erliza (formerly Elspeth Varadin)
Description (Human Life):
Elspeth Varadin was a woman whose presence was more often felt through her contraptions and innovations rather than her personal interactions. Quiet and introspective, Elspeth navigated social situations awkwardly, often appearing more comfortable amongst her mechanical inventions and arcane schematics than in conversation with her peers. Her piercing, intelligent eyes—deep emerald green—often glanced downward, rarely meeting the gaze of others directly, reflecting both her modesty and insecurity.
Despite her social discomfort, Elspeth possessed a keen appreciation for elegance and beauty. While she never considered herself striking, she was meticulous in her attire, favoring intricately embroidered dresses in dark greens and deep blues accented with brass or silver adornments—practical yet refined, mirroring her approach to invention. Her dark brown hair, usually neatly bound in complex braids, was often streaked with soot or arcane residue from hours spent laboring over her latest contraptions.
As a master artificer, Elspeth’s inventions reflected her inner longing for perfection and grace. Her creations, ranging from simple yet beautiful clockwork automatons to elegantly shaped arcane tools, combined functionality with artistry. Her devices, powered by arcane cores or intricately crafted gears and enchanted runes, replicated spell effects through careful and precise mechanical construction. For instance, a “Shield” spell was generated by a wrist-mounted device that projected a translucent barrier, and “Levitate” was accomplished through delicate boots embedded with enchanted, mechanical pistons capable of brief elevation.
While she admired beauty and grace in her designs, Elspeth was cautious not to augment herself directly. She saw herself as imperfect, yet hesitated at the idea of transforming her own body. Instead, she wore refined mechanical accessories that enhanced her natural abilities—bracers that improved her dexterity, a lens worn over one eye granting superior insight into her work, or gloves capable of minor magical manipulation. Her approach was always external augmentation, allowing her to maintain her fragile self-image intact.
Elspeth Varadin’s legacy as a human was defined by her exceptional skill in crafting minor magical items and elegant battle smith modifications. Her workshop was a testament to ingenuity, filled with objects that merged aesthetic elegance with precise functionality—an eternal reflection of her lifelong quest for perfection, grace, and mastery over the mechanical and arcane.
